meanings.definition: Criticizing or insulting someone in an abusive or angrily insulting manner.
meanings.sent1: The reviling words hurt her feelings deeply.
meanings.sent2: He felt upset after hearing the reviling comments.
meanings.sent3: The reviling remarks made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: Her reviling tone echoed in the room, leaving a bitter taste.
meanings.sent5: The reviling behavior was not tolerated in the classroom.

meanings.definition: To subject to verbal abuse or scorn.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't bear the thought of reviling her friend.
meanings.sent2: He was reviling his opponent during the argument.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully reviled each other during the game.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to revile the coastline with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students not to revile their classmates.
